titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Howell, Jones, and Suydam families genealogical notes 1977.524
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:12:48 +0000.

did.unittitle: Howell, Jones, and Suydam families genealogical notes
did.abstract: Four pages of handwritten genealogical notes concerning members of the Jones, Howell, and Suydam families of Brooklyn and Long Island throughout the period 1900 to 1916. The notes were found in the Book of Common Prayer of Susannah Bassett, though the author of the notes is not known.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Howell, Jones, and Suydam families genealogical notes, 1977.524, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
